results.title: Spectacle: Interview with Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Shelley Matulick and ACMI

video_links.name: Spectacle: Interview with Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells

results.brief_description:
“How many exhibitions would have the range of Bob Dylan to Kanye West?” (Jonathan Wells)
Flux Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells share what inspired ‘Spectacle: The Music Video Exhibition’, the challenges in bringing over 300 clips into an exhibition context and their favourite areas in the exhibition.
Created as part of ‘Spectacle: The Music Video Exhibition’ 26 September 2013 - 23 February 2014.

results.title: Round and around
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Produced for use in primary schools to stimulate interest in Melbourne’s annual Royal Agricultural Show. Shows without commentary all the hectic activity of displays, sideshows and the excitement of the Grand Parade.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.

results.title: Applause please
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Experimental Film & Television Fund
results.brief_description: This film makes a personal statement on TV and commercial advertising and their insidious effect on the susceptibility of people. The message is given using an avant-garde style, told in mime and dramatics. Cast includes Max Gillies, Joe Bolza and Bob Thorneycroft and original music performed by Frank Zappa.

results.title: Gel
results.creator_credit: Ralph Henderson, Eric White and Films Sagittaire
results.brief_description: Produced for the Davis Gelatine company, the film uses a domestic science student to outline some of the properties and uses of gelatine. Various examples of modern gelatine cookery are also shown.

results.title: The Minemaker
results.creator_credit: Rod Kinnear, Conzinc Riotinto Australia and Rod Kinnear Productions
results.brief_description: This film describes the varied activities of CRA and its associates and subsidiary companies, including exploration, mining at Broken Hill, the Hammersley Iron project, financing and computer work, Comalco’s aluminium industry, Blair Athol coal, and copper mining on Bougainville.

results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment

video_links.name: The Youth who wanted to shiver

results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment

results.title: The Secondary Teacher
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Describes the life of secondary student teachers in training: accommodation in a boarding house in Armadale, Victoria, for those from the country areas; Melbourne University and the various courses available for students. Also gives details about specialised couses and shows classes in progress. Shows the science, commerce, music and engineering faculties. Narrated by Terry Dear and animation by the Owen Brothers.

results.title: Billabong
results.brief_description: Set among the red gums, this film captures the mood of one day on the Murray River, Echuca, Victoria. Shows where thousands of birds come to breed each year.

results.title: Seeds of change
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Examines changes in Victorian farm life documenting its evolution from horse to tractor to modern machinery. Filmed on location at Jeparit, this program uses period re-creation and documentary footage.
